data.text: Thou shalt proclaim wisdom,
For she is on lofty eminences,
For she sits by the gates of princes,
You, O men, I exhort;
O ye simple, understand subtlety,
Hearken to me; for I will speak solemn truths;
For my throat shall meditate truth;
All the words of my mouth are in righteousness;
They are all evident to those that understand,
Receive instruction, and not silver;
For wisdom is better than precious stones;
I wisdom have dwelt with counsel and knowledge,
The fear of the Lord hates unrighteousness,
Counsel and safety are mine:
By me kings reign,
By me nobles become great,
I love those that love me;
Wealth and glory belong to me;
It is better to have my fruit than to have gold and precious stones;
I walk in ways of righteousness,
That I may divide substance to them that love me,
If I declare to you the things that daily happen,
The Lord made me the beginning of his ways for his works.
He established me before time was in the beginning,
even before he made the depths;
Before the mountains were settled,
The Lord made countries and uninhabited tracts,
When he prepared the heaven, I was present with him;
And when he strengthened the clouds above;
And when he strengthened the foundations of the earth:
I was by him, suiting myself to him,
For he rejoiced when he had completed the world,
Now then, my son, hear me:
Watching daily at my doors,
For my outgoings are the outgoings of life,
But they that sin against me act wickedly against their own souls:
